intro: Guatteria brevipetiolata, commonly known as the short-petioled guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocados, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a smooth, ovoid berry that ripens to a dark purple color, containing several seeds.
